channel.title: Welcome to the Octopus' Garden
channel.description: Recent content on Welcome to the Octopus' Garden

item.title: The Mobius Strip
item.description: Introduction Let’s begin with a rectangular piece of paper, which is sufficiently long. Take one end of the piece of the paper and rotate it by 180 degrees, and attach it to the other end. What you have just made(if done correctly) is something called a Möbius strip(or Moebius). This is a fun shape that a lot of kids make with some free time and a piece of paper. In this somewhat short article, we will see a formula that describes a Möbius strip in 3D Euclidean Space, and ultimately why that formula is wrong.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am Sabarno Saha, a student at IISER-Kolkata studying anything and everything I like. I like Physics and Maths. When I am not studying, which is often, I like quizzing, watching TV Shows and watching random game dev videos on YouTube. I like coding sometimes. My computer runs Arch Linux with Hyprland. I use nvim as my text editor, mostly for writing LaTex stuff. I like listening to music, sometimes a bit too much.
